definition: to seat (sb in a restaurant etc)/to take one's seat
to enter/to go into/to join/to become a member of/to confirm or agree with/abbr. for 入聲|入声[ru4 sheng1]
seat/base/stand/CL:個|个[ge4]/classifier for buildings, mountains and similar immovable objects
to take one's seat according to the ticket number/(fig.) to put (things or people) in their right place/to take a general comment as a personal attack

sentences.english: We can seat you in twenty minutes.
sentences.chinese: 二十他鐘後才能安排您入座。

sentences.english: The Ogre received Puss as civilly as an ogre could do and asked him to sit down.
sentences.chinese: 怪物盡一個怪物所能禮貌的接待了貓，並請他入座。

sentences.english: That included the bus boycotts and the lunch counter sit-ins across the south.
sentences.chinese: 包括抵制公交車運動以及在南方展開便餐館入座運動。

sentences.english: All those unseated will await the next show.
sentences.chinese: 尚未入座者請等待下一場。

sentences.english: In fact, no pigeon-holing is my mood.
sentences.chinese: 其實，無須對號入座的是我的心情。

sentences.english: Officials and fellow candidates already were seated.
sentences.chinese: 等他趕到餐廳時，面試官和其他應聘者都已入座。

sentences.english: When the boss makes general and negative comments, don’t take it personally.
sentences.chinese: 當老闆進行泛泛的批評時，不要對號入座。

sentences.english: Please take your ticket and find your seat.
sentences.chinese: 請您攜帶入場券，對號入座。

sentences.english: Whentakes a seat, if is the familiar visitor, but freely takes a seat.
sentences.chinese: 入席時，如果是熟悉的客人，可自由入座。

sentences.english: The staff members asked the audience to sit in the right seats.
sentences.chinese: 工作人員要求觀衆對號入座。

sentences.english: Number of rain with the wind to fan, one seat to Autumn.
sentences.chinese: 數番雨勢隨風去，一片秋光入座來。

sentences.english: Try not to take a study and compare it to yourself.
sentences.chinese: 不要看了一篇研究就拿自己對號入座。

sentences.english: The story I told was completely made-up, you shouldn't try to tell it to anyone.
sentences.chinese: 我說的這個故事創意純屬虛構，大家不要對號入座。

sentences.english: Table when don't block north had hung on the figure of Buddha.
sentences.chinese: 入座時不要擋住北面哈那上掛着的佛像。

definition: to sit down/to take a seat
to take one's seat
to sit down
to be seated
to sit down
to sit properly/to sit up straight
to absent oneself from a meeting/to decline to attend
to serve food
guest and host
to exchange conventional greetings/to exchange pleasantries
to retire/to withdraw/to retreat/to step down
to pour wine or liquor
to eat a meal
guest of honor/host and guests
to return a politeness/to present a gift in return
to sit on the ground or the floor (idiom)
